note.p: Education: St Andrews University; Edinburgh University. MD (1814, Edinburgh)

Career: Entered Army Medical Department (1816); worked in Canada; developed interest in geology; Secretary and medical officer to the Boundary Commission, Canada (1822); left the army (1823); returned to England and practised in Newark-on-Trent (1827-1846); moved to London and devoted himself to geology; published "Thesaurus Siluricus" (1868); gave money to the Geological Society to found a medal
Obituaries: Proc Roy Soc 1881-1882 vol 33 pp xvi-xvii
References: Susan Sheets-Pyenson, '"Pearls Before Swine": Sir William Dawson's Bakerian Lecture of 1870' in NR 1991 vol 45 pp 177-191
